shortcv.p: Dr. Spiros Borotis is a Researcher Associate in the Athens University of Economics and Business, at the Department of Management Science and Technology. He was born in Athens, Greece, in 1976. He holds a B.Sc. in Mathematics (University of Patras), and an M.Sc. in Information Systems (Athens University of Economics and Business). He also holds a Ph.D. degree in Information Systems (thesis title: E-Learning readiness assessment: Factors affecting learnersâ€™ attitudes towards e-Learning in the enterprise) from the Department of Management Science and Technology of Athens University of Economics and Business (2009). He has been a member of ISTLab for 10 years and now he is a research associate of OIS, and has been involved in various research and development projects. His main research interests are focused on the identification of training needs, e-Learning strategies, Human Resource Development, and Information Systems.

phd-info.phd-title: E-Learning readiness assessment: Factors affecting learners' attitudes towards e-Learning in the enterprise

phd-summary.p: e-Learning attracts considerable interest in contemporary corporate training curricula. As it usually concerns a significant investment, organizations that tend to adopt and maintain it effectively and efficiently in the long term, need to learn from the pioneers. Literature and practical experience indicate critical success factors and frameworks for adoption in both organizational and individual levels. This study tries to examine thoroughly the acceptance of e-Learning from employees - learners.
